snippet: Under a new policy, officers will be allowed to wear a beard that extends one-half inch from their faces and blue turbans adorned with department shields....
abstract: New York Police Dept announces that it will allow Sikh police officers to wear beards and blue turbans while in uniform; Police Officer Gurvinder Singh, president of Sikh Officers Assn, says new allowances will help department efforts to recruit more diverse force.

byline.contributor: Arielle Dollinger contributed reporting. Susan C. Beachy contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Under a new policy, officers will be allowed to wear a beard that extends one-half inch from their faces and blue turbans adorned with department shields.

headline.main: Religious Police Officers in New York Will Be Able to Wear Beards and Turbans
headline.print_headline: Police Ease Rules on Beards and Turbans for Religious Officers
